keyword: calories in a pound of ground turkey
title: Calories in a Pound of Ground Turkey
meta_description: Discover calories in a pound of ground turkey, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: Calories in a Pound of Ground Turkey
assumptions: Raw ground turkey, 85% lean/15% fat; no added seasonings or fillers; 1 pound ≈ 454 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by lean percentage, brand, raw vs. cooked state, and cooking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A pound of 85% lean ground turkey provides ~649 kcal and ~85 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Cooked and drained (fat loss during cooking)
Add 1 tbsp oil for cooking per pound

faqs.q: How many calories in a pound of ground turkey?
faqs.a: Approximately 649 kcal for 85% lean raw ground turkey.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a pound of ground turkey?
faqs.a: About 85 g of protein, making it a lean meat option.

faqs.q: Does lean percentage affect calories in ground turkey?
faqs.a: Yes—93% lean has ~120 kcal per 100 g vs. 143 kcal for 85% lean.

faqs.q: Are these values for raw or cooked ground turkey?
faqs.a: Raw; cooking reduces weight and fat, lowering calories per serving.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a pound of ground turkey?
faqs.a: Around 38 g total fat, with 9.5 g saturated, for 85% lean.
